snippet.title: NINJA GAIDEN (Arcade) - No Death Clear
snippet.description:
I finally got around to learning the original Ninja Gaiden, which was a Double Dragon type of beat 'em up. It still holds up pretty well, and it's cool seeing the ninja actions they created for the game - a lot of which were carried forward into the 3D reboot series. And as a wrestling fan, I always get a kick out of the references in these old games, like the Road Warriors appearing as bosses (complete with a knockoff Iron Man theme), and a big Stan Hansen sign lol. But I digress. 
The game itself is pretty fun, though it has some boring segments and a bit of jank you need to adapt to. It's also not very hard, so I think it's worth giving a shot for fans of the newer games if you want to see where it all started. Note that there are a few more guaranteed 1ups you can after stage 2, but I skipped them because that woul just add some unnecessary risk for what I was trying to do.
